DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this image acquisition study is to compare, in a Reader Study, the Tomosynthesis System used in conjunction with a conventional 2-D digital imaging system (2-D plus 3-D images) to the conventional 2-D digital imaging system (2-D images), and to determine whether the 2-D plus 3-D images compared to the 2-D images alone will improve receiver operating characteristic (ROC) area under the curve.
DOC.criteria: Female Any ethnic origin No contraindication of routine bilateral mammography Any contraindications to mammographic screening, including but not limited to: Significant existing breast trauma Pregnancy Lactating Previous surgical biopsy Previous breast cancer Placement of an internal breast marker Breast implants Unable to understand and execute written informed consent Breasts are too large to be imaged on the 24 cm by 29 cm detector with a single exposure
